lead_paragraph: Seve Ballesteros of Spain officially retired yesterday, after a record 50 victories on the European Tour, 5 major championships and a Ryder Cup career that helped Europe shed its underdog image.He has not been a factor the last decade because of back injuries and has rarely played during the last couple of years.Ballasteros, who made his professional debut at the 1974 Spanish Open, won the British Open three times and the Masters twice. He won 87 titles over all. He was the youngest Masters champion, at 23, until Tiger Woods came along. He returned to Augusta National this year, but finished last after rounds of 86-80. He tried one Champions Tour event after turning 50 in April, but again came in last.
